channel.title: Worth It?
channel.description:
I just got into Rsps, and I want to go farther. I want to actually learn the Java language. I ordered a Java book for dummies, do you think it was worth it? Have any other books I should get also or instead? Feedback is really appreciated.
-John

item.title: Worth It?
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote="-John, post:1, topic:338596"]I just got into Rsps, and I want to go farther. I want to actually learn the Java language. I ordered a Java book for dummies, do you think it was worth it? Have any other books I should get also or instead? Feedback is really appreciated.

-John[/quote]
Learn c, and try to get into some web design/development and you’ll be a rich person in your latter life. Just don’t end up like me pirating software only to almost be shut down and fined, then having to take about 16trillion courses on anti-virus software and copyright laws.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Worth It?
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:2, topic:338596”]Simple answer: No
All the X for dummies books are really stupid and are not helpful.

100% of my java knowledge has been acquired via the internet. The java tutorials written by sun(oracle now) are an excellent resource as long as you read every chapter in the basics section. I have also read leepoint.net’s java notes which offer a brief on literary all the basic aspects of the language. Both sites include example programs which I strongly suggest you take a look at.

There are some decent paper java books out there, i’m sure another member can direct you to them.

edit: just realised my dumb touchpad moved some things[/quote]

Me too.

Read full topic

item.title: Worth It?
item.dc:creator: @John6 -John
item.description:
@John6 wrote:

Thanks for all the feed back. I’m ordering a book and going to use internet tutorials. Frell’s post with links in it helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Worth It?
item.dc:creator: @Ventrozip Ventrozip
item.description:
@Ventrozip wrote:

I’d say it was worth it yes, but you should have gotten a better quality book, cause I don’t think the “For Dummies” version is going to benefit you lol… and great idea, if you learn a programming language you won’t have any problems when it comes to something related to that language, creating things in that language. Good luck man :).

Read full topic

item.title: Worth It?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

You can read a million books over it but the only way you will extremely progress is if you get out there and program. You learn a lot from your mistakes, and how are you going to have mistakes if you never try. :]

item.title: Worth It?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Simple answer: No
All the X for dummies books are really stupid and are not helpful.

100% of my java knowledge has been acquired via the internet. The java tutorials written by sun(oracle now) are an excellent resource as long as you read every chapter in the basics section. I have also read leepoint.net’s java notes which offer a brief on literary all the basic aspects of the language. Both sites include example programs which I strongly suggest you take a look at.

There are some decent paper java books out there, i’m sure another member can direct you to them.
